Short: Tracking of latest field safety corrective action
Definition: Tracking of latest field safety corrective action.
Condition(s):
ele-1:All FHIR elements must have a @value or children {hasValue() or (children().count() > id.count())}
ext-1:Must have either extensions or value[x], not both {extension.exists() != value.exists()}

Definition: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.
An Extension
Slicing Description: Extensions are always sliced by (at least) url
Constraint(s):

Short: Whether the corrective action was a recall
Definition: Whether the last corrective action known for this device was a recall.
Comments: When a field safety action has been initiated but not yet resulted in a recall, this element will be set to 'false'.
Requirements:
Element `DeviceDefinition.correctiveAction.recall` is part of an existing definition because parent element `DeviceDefinition.correctiveAction` requires a cross-version extension.
Element `DeviceDefinition.correctiveAction.recall` is will have a context of DeviceDefinition based on following the parent source element upwards and mapping to `DeviceDefinition`.
Condition(s):
ele-1:All FHIR elements must have a @value or children {hasValue() or (children().count() > id.count())}
ext-1:Must have either extensions or value[x], not both {extension.exists() != value.exists()}

Short: identifies the meaning of the extension
Definition: Source of the definition for the extension code - a logical name or a URL.
Comments: The definition may point directly to a computable or human-readable definition of the extensibility codes, or it may be a logical URI as declared in some other specification. The definition SHALL be a URI for the Structure Definition defining the extension.

Definition: The scope of the corrective action - whether the action targeted all units of a given device model, or only a specific set of batches identified by lot numbers, or individually identified devices identified by the serial name.
Requirements:
Element `DeviceDefinition.correctiveAction.scope` is part of an existing definition because parent element `DeviceDefinition.correctiveAction` requires a cross-version extension.
Element `DeviceDefinition.correctiveAction.scope` is will have a context of DeviceDefinition based on following the parent source element upwards and mapping to `DeviceDefinition`.
